title: Bryan Fury has been announced for Tekken 8, unannounced and then announced again
description: Bryan Fury has finally joined the fight in Tekken 8, following an accidental post before his scheduled debut.

title: Nintendo explains the decision behind blocking release of Dolphin emulator
description: Nintendo has explained why it decided to block the Steam release of GameCube and Wii emulator Dolphin.

title: Microsoft reveals Azure Linux is available now
description: Azure Linux container host for Azure Kubernetes Service is now available following months of testing.

title: Nvidia reveals a whole new kind of Ethernet for generative AI
description: Blisteringly quick Ethernet speeds are being enabled by Nvidia Spectrum-X technology.

title: A gaming Chromebook with an Nvidia RTX graphics card? Sign me up
description: A new partnership between Google and Nvidia will see the latest RTX GPUs make their way into two upcoming Chromebooks.

title: Windows 11 cloud backup is getting a whole lot better at last
description: Windows 11 is set to get a new cloud backup tool that covers just about all bases, and it’s in Preview now.

title: HP printers could soon lose their official environmental certification following user fury
description: The IITC has asked the Global Electronics Council to revoke eco-certification from around 100 HP printers.

title: Watch out - that Amazon or Microsoft ad could just be malware
description: Just because an ad is on Google, it doesn't mean it's clean - hackers can abuse the platform to deliver malware.

title: More and more criminals are using legitimate websites to obfuscate malicious payloads
description: Legitimate services can be used to bypass protections and deliver malware to victims more easily, experts warn.

title: 5 things I can't wait to see at Computex 2023
description: Computex 2022 was more of a somber event. This year, I’m looking forward to manufacturers bringing in the fun stuff.

title: Most CEOs now see cybersecurity as more important than economic performance
description: Growing cybersecurity threats are keeping many CEOs up at night.

title: Spotify festival: how to generate your dream festival lineup poster
description: Use the Instafest app and your music listening history to produce a festival lineup perfectly aligned to your tastes.

title: Bigger iPhone 16 Pro sizes are rumored to be making room for camera upgrades
description: There's more information on the larger iPhone 16 Pro and Pro Max models, which could be the biggest iPhones yet.

title: Microsoft Defender Antivirus is getting a new performance mode, but you probably won't ever see it
description: Microsoft Defender performance mode for developers only, but it should speed up build times.

title: Apple shuts My Photo Stream on July 26, so make sure you don't lose your photos
description: It launched alongside iCloud in 2011 to sync your photos and videos, but now My Photo Stream is going away.

title: This new malware hijacks Windows WordPad to avoid detection
description: Qbot operators are at it again, using legitimate software to distribute malware via Windows WordPad.

title: Quordle today - hints and answers for Monday, May 29 (game #490)
description: Looking for Quordle clues? We can help. Plus get the answers to Quordle today and past solutions.

title: This tiny laptop charger has a 1TB SSD and automatic backup functionality
description: iXCharger delivers an intriguing combination but will it be good enough for the rest of us?

title: Nvidia Computex 2023 Keynote Live: On the ground at Computex 2023
description: The Computex 2023 opening keynote from Nvidia is a break from AMD tradition, but Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang is sure to deliver some major news at the event.
